-spec check_strings(S1 :: unicode:unicode_binary(), S2 :: unicode:unicode_binary()) -> boolean().
check_strings(S1, S2) ->
    % Convert binaries to lists of characters (since Erlang strings are lists)
    List1 = binary_to_list(S1),
    List2 = binary_to_list(S2),
    
    % Extract even and odd indexed characters from both strings
    {Evens1, Odds1} = extract_even_odd(List1, [], [], 0),
    {Evens2, Odds2} = extract_even_odd(List2, [], [], 0),
    
    % Sort the extracted characters to compare
    SortedEvens1 = lists:sort(Evens1),
    SortedOdds1 = lists:sort(Odds1),
    SortedEvens2 = lists:sort(Evens2),
    SortedOdds2 = lists:sort(Odds2),
    
    % Check if both strings have the same set of characters at even and odd positions
    SortedEvens1 == SortedEvens2 andalso SortedOdds1 == SortedOdds2.

% Helper function to extract even and odd indexed characters
extract_even_odd([], Evens, Odds, _) ->
    {Evens, Odds};
extract_even_odd([H | T], Evens, Odds, Index) ->
    if 
        Index rem 2 == 0 -> extract_even_odd(T, [H | Evens], Odds, Index + 1);
        true -> extract_even_odd(T, Evens, [H | Odds], Index + 1)
    end.
